page.title: 15THOMAS BEWICK TRUST
page.content:
Thomas Bewick-born at Cherryburn Farm, Mickley 1753, died 1828- was certainly Northumberland's most famous artist. He is renowned throughout the world. He brought the art form of engraving on wood from crudeness to a degree of technical perfection which has still not been exceeded. The small Bewick family farm came up for sale in 1982-almost unchanged in appearance since the early 1800's- so a group decided to form a Trust to purchase and operate it as in Bewick's day; to show through the existing landscape how the countryside influenced Bewick's work, and to form a museum.
{Douglas Mennear, Hon Sec THOMAS BEWICK BIRTHPLACE TRUST
